SEARCH
Package movielist

Class LoginManager

java.lang.Object
movielist.LoginManager
public class LoginManager extends Object
The LoginManager class handles user login and registration for the Movie List app. It supports signing in, signing up, loading users from a file, and saving user data to a file. This class utilizes a local, in-memory database of users using a Map, and interacts with the user through console prompts.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    LoginManager()
    Constructs a LoginManager with empty user database and initializes a scanner.

  • Constructor Details

    • LoginManager

      public LoginManager()
      Constructs a LoginManager with empty user database and initializes a scanner.

  • Method Details

    • loadUsersFromFile

      public void loadUsersFromFile()
      Prompts user for filename and loads users from said file. If successful, it stores them in the in-memory database. Catches and displays file-related errors.

    • loadUsersFromFile

      public void loadUsersFromFile(String filename) throws IOException
      Loads users from a specified file for testing purposes.
      Parameters:
      filename - Name of the file to load.
      Throws:
      IOException - if file cannot be read.

    • signIn

      public User signIn()
      Prompts user for ID and PIN to authenticate and sign in. If credentials are valid, returns the corresponding User object.
      Returns:
      the signed-in User, or null if authentication fails

    • signUp

      public void signUp()
      Prompts user to create a new account, including ID, PIN, email, and age. Validates the input and adds the user to the database if successful. Also saves the user to a file for persistence.

    • logout

      public void logout()
      Logs out current user by clearing the currentUser reference.

    • saveUserToFile

      public void saveUserToFile(User user)
      Saves a user to a file.
      Parameters:
      user - The user to be saved.

    • getUserDatabase

      public Map<String,User> getUserDatabase()
      Returns current in-memory user database.
      Returns:
      a Map containing user IDs mapped to User objects
